channel.title: Windows 7-8
channel.description:
So I like windows 8 and all but will windows 7 run my games faster?
Call Of Duty Modern Warfare 1-2 Just cause 1 Mission against terror Test drive unlimited 1-2 and also, My movies when I download my movie lags when mopar or facebook is up in the background it lags
I have allot more problems but that'll take me forever to type all of them in lol
Things I like about windows 8 the lock screen, the tiles, and thats basically it I love windows 7 so should I downgrade for better gaming?

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I haven’t found a game that won’t run on Windows 8, some of them you’ll have to do workarounds on, but it’s not much of a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

sppt:

The only game that doesn’t work properly for me on Windows 8 is gta 4, due to the stupid amount of drm technologies included in the game. There seems to be a conflict between securom and gfwl, which makes it impossible to start the game unless I use xliveless, which removes gfwl but also the multiplayer functionality. It’s fudgeing stupid that they put like 4 or 5 layers of drm in that game…

GFWL doesn’t seem to agree with Windows 8 for whatever reason (the irony). I can’t play any games that go with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:18, topic:545934”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=664825.msg4444769#msg4444769 date=1408210153]

The only game that doesn’t work properly for me on Windows 8 is gta 4, due to the stupid amount of drm technologies included in the game. There seems to be a conflict between securom and gfwl, which makes it impossible to start the game unless I use xliveless, which removes gfwl but also the multiplayer functionality. It’s fudgeing stupid that they put like 4 or 5 layers of drm in that game…

So tats why I couldn’t start the game?
[/quote]
Most likely. Try xliveless, or try [sub]to dump the game because it’s garbage[/sub][/quote]

I’ll juss get rid of it, but anyways I can run most valve games I ran zelda on windows 8 the first zelda most games that say “Only compatible with xp/vista” are lies lol

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

I, personally, prefer windows 7 by a longshot. I just like the interface more. However I haven’t had any issues with windows 8 whatsoever, period. Whether it may be from gaming, to online homework, to youtube, windows 8 never failed me. Quit ur bitchin.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It’s possible your card manufacturer didn’t have a windows 8 driver at the time, so ‘updating’ did nothing. What card do you have? It’s also possible you had the wrong java version, which didn’t allow the lwjgl libraries to hook in natively, etc. It’s not a problem with windows 8, plenty of people have it working fine there.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:12, topic:545934”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=664825.msg4444541#msg4444541 date=1408092493]

[quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=664825.msg4444483#msg4444483 date=1408067743]

Windows 8 is a joke, if you want to be able to play about every game with no problems, use windows 7
[/quote]I’ve had no problem running any games on Windows 8. That’s like saying “windows 7 is a joke, if you want to play about every game use windows 95” because there might be games that wont run on XP+.

I only downgraded from windows 8 to windows 7 on my laptop because on windows 8 it wouldn’t let me run minecraft because of some graphics card driver issues , Then i tried windows 7 because it used to work normally back then. And when i finished installing it , I launched minecraft and it ran perfectly.

That sounds like a driver problem, not OS problem.

What do you mean?
[/quote]He means it has nothing to do with Windows 8 being the problem, it was your graphics card drivers not being updated.

This. But a lot of the time, the manufacturer will only support Windows 7 and not Windows 8, so there’s no drivers for a specific device, that usually happens with laptops. For example, I upgraded my laptop from Vista to Windows 7 immediately as I got it… HP only supports drivers for Vista (why? Who enjoys Vista?)

I did make sure that i updated my graphics card driver on both windows 8 and 7 and it only worked on 7 when i did it? weird.

Hmm, depends on the method you used. It usually works best if you get them from the manufacturers site.[/quote]

Yes , i did that on both Os’s. Only worked on 7

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:11, topic:545934”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=664825.msg4444483#msg4444483 date=1408067743]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=664825.msg4444449#msg4444449 date=1408056351]

Windows 8 is a joke, if you want to be able to play about every game with no problems, use windows 7
[/quote]I’ve had no problem running any games on Windows 8. That’s like saying “windows 7 is a joke, if you want to play about every game use windows 95” because there might be games that wont run on XP+.

I only downgraded from windows 8 to windows 7 on my laptop because on windows 8 it wouldn’t let me run minecraft because of some graphics card driver issues , Then i tried windows 7 because it used to work normally back then. And when i finished installing it , I launched minecraft and it ran perfectly.

That sounds like a driver problem, not OS problem.

What do you mean?
[/quote]He means it has nothing to do with Windows 8 being the problem, it was your graphics card drivers not being updated.

This. But a lot of the time, the manufacturer will only support Windows 7 and not Windows 8, so there’s no drivers for a specific device, that usually happens with laptops. For example, I upgraded my laptop from Vista to Windows 7 immediately as I got it… HP only supports drivers for Vista (why? Who enjoys Vista?)

I did make sure that i updated my graphics card driver on both windows 8 and 7 and it only worked on 7 when i did it? weird.[/quote]

Hmm, depends on the method you used. It usually works best if you get them from the manufacturers site.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Yeah, from having Windows 8 and 7 on the same laptop, I have to agree that Windows 8 is much faster. Plus you can pin all of our games to the “start/tile menu”, which I found useful.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7-8
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No. Windows 8 is actually faster than windows 7. You should only downgrade if you really cant stand the tiles and start screen. It sounds like you enjoy those, so you have no reason to downgrade.

Read full topic
